wiki.summary: "Dream" is the final track on LISA’s debut album, Alter Ego. The only ballad on the album, the song reflects a past relationship of LISA, where she is still holding on to her feelings for the other person and yearning for another chance. However, it’s clear that the feelings aren’t reciprocated, as the other person has seemingly moved on. Despite this, LISA acknowledges the impact they once had in her life and expresses a hope that, even if they can’t be together romantically, they could still remain friends. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: "Dream" is the final track on LISA’s debut album, Alter Ego. The only ballad on the album, the song reflects a past relationship of LISA, where she is still holding on to her feelings for the other person and yearning for another chance. However, it’s clear that the feelings aren’t reciprocated, as the other person has seemingly moved on. Despite this, LISA acknowledges the impact they once had in her life and expresses a hope that, even if they can’t be together romantically, they could still remain friends. The song was first introduced in an activity LISA and her team created for her fans, allowing them to connect their music to discover which alter ego of hers matches their vibe and get a sneak preview of an unreleased track. This track was revealed when they received her alter ego, Sunni, who is described to be LISA’s softer side. Read more on Last.fm.
